answers.answer: You really do need to at least be watching your numbers, even if you aren't going to the Dr. Diabetes is a very serious illness.... One of my friends her daughter recently died from complications caused by diabetes, and at the time she didn't even know she was diabetic.

Your doctor could discharge you as a patient if they wanted to due to noncompliance. If you were unsatisfied with the gd doctor the best thing would have been to get another one not just stop going because diabetes if very serious. But keep monitoring.

I agree with the others.  You're not taking this seriously.If your numbers were high enough to consider insulin,  you need to care more about this.I'm very surprised your mother hasn't stepped in and told you that you need to pay attention to this,  and track your blood sugar.

While i understand your frustration, you are in a sense "playing with fire". I am a diabetic . I sometimes get frustrated because my ob Dr says one thing about my levels and my perinatal specialist and diabetes educator say something else. Checking your levels is for your safety and that of your baby. Especially in the last few weeks, at 39weeks the risk of stillbirth goes up drastically if sugars are not well controlled.

Diabetes is very serious. I work as a nurse as well. I had the unfortunate experience of working with a mom who wad noncompliant with her diabetes regimen. Her baby died at 32 weeks because of complications. It was extremely devestating to see. I felt terrible that it happened and terrible for the parents. There can be very serious complications. Good luck.

You should be thinking about the well being of your unborn child it's a very big deal and your blood sugar should be tracked if you didn't like the doctor you should have expressed it with your ob and seen if you had another option
Gosh way to attack her people!
That's not very responsible of you. It's a serious disease that kills and you're not thinking of your baby.
Trista no one is attacking. People just don't like the truth. No way she thought she could post this and find supporters. I'm just saying.

I wasn't looking for support. It was a vent and to be honest I do think of the complications all damn day. This is my third pregnancy and second with gd. Of course I know the seriousness of the disease I have never been to a doc whom is unsure of what to do even when I was keeping track of my Blood sugar and the numbers were always normal. The only thing my doc is worried about is my baby being too big. No need to talk about having a stillborn or anything having to do with my unborn dyingg. Like cmon. No need for negetive energy here. He's healthy and fine.

They were saying last minute complications that can arise and if u know the risks mayb you'll b more responsible. Even pregnancy is different just bcuz the other baby had no complications that don't mean that will b the case with this one. I wish ur baby the best. N of course it's ur decision n u have to live w ur decisions. I just know mothers on her care and want to see healthy babies and caring parents. I think alot of good advice was givin.

speaking as someone who had gd and now full type 2 I understand the frustration with doctors trying to control your levels ... My  doctors were indecisive about just changing my meds or putting me on insulin.... I hate needles. but typically the reason for the indecision is setting so you won't have lows while controlling levels. I've had a few lows abd they are awful. it's so confusing because they change your dosage repeatedly. because you are so close to the end they want to be extra cautious and gd can be well controlled with diet cutting out bread had.helped me now.. I'm surprised they didn't send you to specialist clinic where the doc makes all decisions...just stick in there to have a healthy little one and be healthy as well praying for you and yours. and check your sugars this is my third and they repeat the risks to let you know how serious it is I didn't want to check regularly either but they should be around 80-90 before eating and under 120after as you may know
I would've expressed my concerns with my reg ob and asked to switch specialists, hope u and ur baby r fine..

question: So two weeks ago I stopped going to my gestational diabetes doc because she wasn't sure on wether to give me insuling or not. Every appointment was something different. At first she said I didn't need it then had me do an A1C test even tho she said she knew my results were gonna be normal. I was getting very irritated and so was my boyfriend. My mother is a registered nurse and she even didn't understand Why she wasn't sure Like cmon. So my obIs thinking I ain't taking this gd seriously and it upsets me for her to think like that. She wants my readings and I haven't been keeping track of my numbers since I stopped going. I'm due in 6 days. Its driving me nuts.
title: stopped my appointments with my gd doc
